entries.security_container_d: A sturdy container designed to keep content secure from exterior damage.
entries.large_plain_crate_d: A large storage crate with no markings to tell what it contains.
entries.warren_skeleton_d: This appears to be the devastated corpse of a human. However, it is likely that equipment or items might still be found in the remains.
entries.warren_tech_chest_d: A small metal chest, used to hold equipment and supplies. These are sometimes equipped with electronic locks.
entries.warren_tech_armoire_d: A sectioned metal locker. Sometimes equipped with electronic locks, these are usually used for storing equipment or valuables.
entries.placable_loot_crate_skeleton_d: These are the remains of an ill-fated adventurer. It is likely that equipment and credits may be extracted from this pile of bones.
entries.placable_loot_crate_trashpile_d: A random collection of loose debris is piled here for reasons unknown. Intelligent wild creatures often gather materials such as these to construct nests and barriers... and (in some very rare cases) for social rituals that few have observed and lived to recount.
entries.placable_loot_crate_d: A strong, blast proof container used for storing valuables.  These are quite common and cheap to produce.  If the MagSeal lock is in place, you will need to have the key or some way of slicing past the system.
entries.loot_crate_d: This container appears to have been magnetically sealed at one point, but it is open now.
entries.locked_loot_crate_d: This container has been locked with a magnetic seal.  For access, you'll need the key or you'll need to slice the locking system.
entries.treasure_drum_d: A vacuum sealed chamber used for storing items for long periods of time.  It looks like it was just dug out of the ground.
